text: Introduction
Epstein-Barr virus ( EBV ) is a ubiquitous gamma-herpesvirus that infects humans predominantly at an early age with greater than 90 % of the adult population infected with EBV [ 1 ] .

EBV is linked to the development of both B lymphocyte and epithelial cell malignancies , including Burkitt lymphoma , Hodgkin disease ( HD ) , and nasopharyngeal carcinoma ( NPC ) , and cancers linked to immunosuppression , including post-transplant lymphoma and AIDS - associated lymphomas [ 2 , 3 ] .
In vitro infection of B lymphocytes with EBV induces permanent growth transformation , and this ability to affect cell growth regulation likely contributes to the development of cancer .

Many of the viral proteins expressed in transformed cells , including the EBV nuclear antigens and latent membrane proteins , have profound effects on cell growth regulation and are required for EBV latent infection and B cell transformation [ 1 ] .

<extra_id_0> Latent membrane protein 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is considered the major oncoprotein of EBV , as it transforms rodent fibroblasts to tumorigenicity in nude mice and is expressed in HD , NPC , and immunosuppression - associated tumors [ 4-8 ] .

text: In B lymphocytes , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mimics <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling , and both <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are essential for EBV - mediated B cell transformation [ 9-11 ] .

While <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> interacts with <extra_id_0> CD40 ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expressed on activated T cells to induce B cell activation and differentiation , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> acts as a constitutive signal through ligand - independent oligomerization .

text: Activation of NFkappaB is required for EBV - induced B cell transformation and its inhibition rapidly results in cell death [ 17 , 18 ] .

Recent studies indicate that <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also activates phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase ( PI3K ) / <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling and that this activation is required for <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transformation of rodent fibroblasts [ 5 , 19 ] .
In vitro , primary B cells can be maintained by <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation in combination with <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment .

In vivo , <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling is necessary for germinal center ( GC ) formation such that mice deficient for <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are unable to form GCs in response to T cell - dependent antigens [ 20 , 21 ] .

text: However , <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is unable to restore affinity maturation and GC formation [ 23 ] .

Several EBV transforming proteins have been studied in transgenic mouse models , however , only <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces tumor development when expressed under the control of the Ig heavy chain promoter and enhancer [ 24-26 ] .

text: The <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic mice ( IgLMP1 ) express <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in B lymphocytes , and in mice older than 12 mo , lymphoma develops with increased incidence ( 40 % -50 % ) compared to wild-type control mice ( 11 % ) , suggesting that <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contributes to tumor development [ 26 ] .

The <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> lymphomas have rearranged Ig genes and have activated <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , JNK , p38 , and NFkappaB , with specific activation of the NFkappaB family member <extra_id_0> cRel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 27 ] .

text: In this study , the <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphocytes and lymphomas were further characterized and their growth properties in vitro were determined .
To obtain pure populations of malignant lymphocytes and to enable more detailed biochemical analyses , examples of primary lymphomas were inoculated and passaged in SCID mice .
Interestingly , lymphoma development was restricted to B-1a lymphocytes , a self-replenishing population of cells that are prone to malignancy [ 28 , 29 ] .

<extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic lymphocytes had increased viability in vitro and viability was increased by the addition of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In contrast , both <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive and - negative lymphoma cells were independent of <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> co - stimulation for survival and proliferation in vitro with a complete absence of activated <extra_id_0> Stat6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the <extra_id_0> IL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> target .

text: The lymphomas were also distinguished by constitutive activation of <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and deregulation of the <extra_id_0> Rb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cell cycle pathway .

Inhibition of the PI3K / <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , NFkappaB , and <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathways blocked the enhanced growth of both <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic and malignant lymphocytes , suggesting that these pathways are required for their growth and survival .
These appear to be the same targets that are deregulated in wild-type B-1a lymphomas that arise spontaneously through age predisposition .

This study reveals that <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promotes malignancy in cells with the inherent ability to proliferate and that the <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , NFkappaB , and <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathways are required for its growth stimulatory effects .
